page.title: 18Dunmow's Society of Friends
page.content: The Society of Friends have their meeting house in New Street, Dunmow. They meet there on Sundays at eleven o'clock. Another name for the Friends is Quakers. The service has no set pattern to it. The Friends all sit around in a circle. Sometimes nothing is said at all because they are concentrating their minds on God. If somebody wants to speak then he or she will stand up and tell a story or say what happened to them during the week or say a prayer. They have no ceremonies, statues or prayerbooks like other Christian churches and believe that there is a bit of God in everyone - even bad people. Every fifth Sunday the Quakers join with other Christian churches in Dunmow to have a service together.
